Comment: >> 25 or 6 to 4     > What the hell did that even mean? Had a lifetime to figure it out and I still have no clue.    My wife told me her late stepdad had explained to her when she was a kid that the way it should be read is this:    "it's 25 or (twenty-) 6, before 4 AM."    The song is about a man (Robert Lamm, the keyboard player for the group that this song is from, Chicago) who is up all night trying to write these lyrics. The song he's writing is supposed to be a callback to the group's previous song, "*Does Anybody Really Know What Time It Is?*" from the group's first album (and also written by Lamm).     So Lamm wrote: "Feeling like I ought to sleep. Spinning room is sinking deep. Searching for something to say. Waiting for the break of day. Should I try to do some more? Twenty-five or six to four."    Why that last bit? Because when he finished writing these lyrics, it was at 3:34 or 3:35 AM.    25 or 6 minutes before it got to be 4AM.  25 or 6 to 4.    That's when Lamm finished writing the song.    The group decided that Peter Cetera was the better voice to sing it, and Lamm agreed. THAT'S what the song means. Nothing more than about what it takes for a group who is trying to make a song for their second album, the studio wants it NOW, and so they stay up all night to write one to fill out the rest of the album.
